academic_papers.query: Academic research 'dynamic context assembly' OR 'protocol based AI architecture' since 2024
key_findings: Dynamic context assembly is emerging trend in AI systems for runtime resource assembly
Model Context Protocol (MCP) described as 'HTTPS of AI agents' - standard for AI communication
Zero-configuration AI systems trend - agents auto-discover resources without manual setup
Bidirectional AI protocols enable agents to both consume and provide context/capabilities
Intent-driven computing - AI interprets user intent to drive real-time orchestration
academic_papers.competitive_overlap: Conceptual framework overlap but no direct architectural competition

yc_companies.query: Y Combinator W25 S24 companies 'LLM operating system' OR 'AI infrastructure kernel'
key_findings: NO companies explicitly describing themselves as LLM operating systems or AI infrastructure kernels
Over 67% of S24 companies are AI-focused but on applications, not infrastructure
Companies like Adam (AI CAD), Tergle (AI auditing) are vertical solutions, not OS-level
Rally offers 'Financial OS' but this is SaaS platform, not LLM/AI OS
Gap identified: No YC companies working on foundational AI OS or protocol-first platforms
yc_companies.competitive_overlap: No direct competition identified in recent YC batches

vc_investments.query: VC investments 'AI operating system' OR 'LLM platform' OR 'protocol architecture'
key_findings: AI startups raised $52-73B in Q1 2025 (41-58% of global VC)
Investment concentrated in top 10 companies (51% of AI sector funding)
Focus on infrastructure, vertical LLMs, regulatory-compliant AI, edge processing
Notable: Safe Superintelligence raised $1B for 'safe AGI' - potential OS focus
No explicit 'protocol architecture' or 'AI kernel' category investments identified
vc_investments.competitive_overlap: Safe Superintelligence could be potential competitor, others focus on LLM platforms not OS

github_opensource.query: Open source projects 'MCP kernel' OR 'AI operating' OR 'protocol dispatcher'
key_findings: Model Context Protocol org hosts reference implementations in multiple languages
GitHub MCP Server - official MCP server for GitHub API integration
GitMCP (idosal/git-mcp) - converts GitHub repos to AI-accessible docs hubs
MCP + Semantic Kernel integration project showing protocol layer orchestration
Multiple protocol dispatcher examples but no full 'AI operating system' implementations
github_opensource.competitive_overlap: Strong MCP ecosystem but focused on specific integrations, not full OS architecture

patent_landscape.query: Patents 2023-2025 'dynamic context assembly' OR 'AI operating system kernel'
key_findings: USPTO accelerated issuance - reduced time from 3 weeks to 2 weeks (May 2025)
High patent activity in dynamic context assembly for real-time AI applications
AI OS kernel patents focus on lightweight OS cores for distributed AI workloads
Protocol-based AI architecture patents growing - agent negotiation, standardized interfaces
Intent classification patents high volume - LLM integration, context-dependent resolution
patent_landscape.competitive_overlap: Active patent landscape but no specific 'protocol-as-kernel' patents identified

competitive_gaps_identified: No YC companies working on foundational AI OS
VC investments focused on applications, not kernel-level architecture
MCP ecosystem exists but no protocol-as-kernel implementations
Patent activity in components but not integrated OS approach
Academic interest in concepts but no implemented systems
key_differentiators: Zero static configuration at OS level

immediate_recommendations: Continue research mission - current findings very positive for uniqueness
File provisional patents for protocol-as-kernel architecture
Document technical differentiators vs MCP ecosystem projects
Consider open source strategy to establish thought leadership
